newsitem.title: GERMANY: Tietmeyer-starting date for EMU to remain 1999.
newsitem.headline: Tietmeyer-starting date for EMU to remain 1999.

text.p: Bundesbank President Hans Tietmeyer said on Wednesday that he assumed the starting date for European Economic and Monetary Union would remain January 1 1999 as planned.
Tietmeyer was quoted in a parliamentary document which summarised proceedings during a meeting of the Budget Committee of Germany's Bundestag.
Tietmeyer-starting date for EMU to remain 1999 =2

The Bundesbank would continue to prepare for a January 1 1999 starting date, Tietmeyer said according to a report on parliamentary proceedings called Heute im Bundestag, published by the government press office.
The European Central Bank had to be ready to open for business by July 1 1998, Tietmeyer said.
He added that the timeframe was narrow because EMU membership and therefore ECB board membership would be decided using data which would not be available before March 1998.
